definition:
The [**Jacobi symbol**]{} is a generalization of the Legendre symbol to
all odd positive integers.

Let $n$ be an odd positive integer, with prime factorization
${p_1}^{e_1} \cdots {p_k}^{e_k}$. Let $a \geq 0$ be an integer. The
[*Jacobi symbol*]{} $\left(\frac{a}{n}\right)$ is defined to be
$$\left(\frac{a}{n}\right) = \prod_{i=1}^k \left(\frac{a}{p_i}\right)^{e_i}$$
where $\left(\frac{a}{p_i}\right)$ is the Legendre symbol of $a$ and
$p_i$.

A further generalization of the Legendre symbol, due to Kronecker, is
the Kronecker symbol.
